task_summary: Locate the dishwasher handle, grasp it, and pull to open the hinged door, then retreat to clear the opened door.

task_long_description.overview: The sequence controls a Hello Robot Stretch‑like manipulator in a kitchen scene with a stainless appliance featuring a horizontal bar handle consistent with a dishwasher door; the robot must perceive the handle, approach precisely, grasp, and execute an opening motion appropriate for a downward‑hinged door, then back away to avoid collision while the door opens.[web:3][web:6]
preconditions: Appliance is accessible from the right side with unobstructed handle reach.[web:3]
Robot base is stably positioned and arm has clearance for pulling a hinged door.[web:6]
Gripper operational and able to close on a bar‑style handle.[web:6]
stepwise_plan: Check visibility of the dishwasher handle; if not visible, scan raster to find it.[web:3]
Detect and localize the handle and compute a pulling grasp pose.[web:6]
Approach and align, open gripper, then execute the pick to secure the handle.[web:6]
Set wrist yaw for pulling direction and issue an open‑container command for a hinged door.[web:3]
Retreat to create space once the door begins opening and wait briefly to settle.[web:6]
success_criteria: Dishwasher door angle increases from closed; latch disengaged and motion observed.[web:5]
Robot maintains stable grasp during initial opening without collision.[web:6]
failure_and_recovery: If handle not found, repeat raster scan up to configured attempts.[web:3]
If grasp unstable, re‑open gripper and recompute grasp before retrying pull.[web:6]
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates after a successful open operation followed by a short wait and retreat to a safe standoff.[web:3]

frame_4.now_evidence: Gripper is firmly on the handle indicating grasp completion and readiness to pull.
frame_4.predicts_next: Opening motion initiation is the logical next step after securing grasp.

node_specs.description: Checks whether the dishwasher handle is currently visible.
Performs a raster scan to locate the handle if not visible.
Runs object detection to refine the handle pose.
Computes a pulling grasp for the bar handle and stores it to the blackboard.
Moves above the handle to a safe pregrasp height.
Approaches and aligns the gripper with the handle within tight tolerance.
Opens gripper to accept the handle.
Executes the grasp using the precomputed handle pose.
Verifies the grasp stability before pulling.
Orients the wrist to align with the pull direction.
Commands opening of a downward‑hinged dishwasher door while grasping the handle.
Backs off to avoid collision with the opening door.
Brief pause to allow door motion to settle.

failure_modes: Handle not detected due to glare or pose ambiguity.
Door binds due to latch not released or obstruction.
Robot collides with door while opening.
recovery_strategy: Re‑scan with RetryUntilSuccessful and adjust alignment.
Re‑open gripper, recompute grasp, and repeat pick.
Increase yaw alignment and reissue OpenContainer after reseating grasp.
Retreat slightly, re‑approach with smaller tolerance before pull.
assumptions: The stainless appliance in frames appears to be a dishwasher with a horizontal bar handle; if it is an oven, the same hinged‑door opening procedure still applies, but dynamics differ—design favors the visual frames.

expected_success_criteria: Door visibly opens after OpenContainer while grasp remains stable.
Robot ends at a safe offset without contact after Retreat.
